Class Person

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.types.Tuple
      • common.types.Tuple1<java.lang.String>
        • Person
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Person
extends common.types.Tuple1<java.lang.String>
    A instance represents a person and their health.
    Author:
    Mshnik

    • Constructor Detail

      • Person

        public Person(java.lang.String n,
              Network g,
              int h)
        Constructor: a healthy Person with name n and health h, added to graph g. Precondition: The new person is not in g, and their name is distinct from the name of any other person in g. This is because the name is used for equality and hashing.

      • becomeSick

        public void becomeSick(int currentStep)
        Make this person sick during step currentStep. Throw a RuntimeException if this person is not HEALTHY.

      • becomeImmune

        public void becomeImmune(int currentStep)
        Make this person immune during step currentStep. Throw a RuntimeException if this person is immune or dead.

      • reduceHealth

        public void reduceHealth(int currentStep)
        Decrement the health of this person in step currentStep. If its health becomes 0, the person dies. Throw a RuntimeException if this person is not sick.
